# Getting the JWKS endpoint and issuer URLs

### On the backend

<BackendSDKTabs>
<TabItem value="nodejs">

```jsx
let Session = require("supertokens-node/recipe/session");

let {issuer, jwks_uri} = await Session.getOpenIdDiscoveryConfiguration();
```

</TabItem>
<TabItem value="go">

```go
WIP
```
</TabItem>
<TabItem value="python">

```python
WIP
```

</TabItem>
</BackendSDKTabs>

### On the frontend

SuperTokens exposes a HTTP API that can be used on the frontend or by external services. You can find the API definition under the OpenId recipe in our [Frontend driver interface (FDI)](https://supertokens.io/docs/fdi) reference

A sample response:

```json
{
    "issuer": "https://api.test.com/auth",
    "jwks_uri": "https://api.test.com/auth/jwt/jwks.json"
}
```

:::info
By default SuperTokens uses your <BackendSDKCasing>apiDomain</BackendSDKCasing>, <BackendSDKCasing>apiGatewayPath</BackendSDKCasing> and <BackendSDKCasing>apiBasePath</BackendSDKCasing> for the issuer URL, [read more here](./enabling-jwts#using-a-custom-issuer) if you want to use a custom URL instead.
:::
